channel.title: xylem | Gordon Beeming
channel.description: Gordon Beeming - Father • Husband • Triathlete • SSW Solution Architect

item.title: Start-BitsTransfer : Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
item.description: Today I find myself with yet another bit of functionality that only works when you are running in Administrator Mode. A while back I had Full Admin Mode always enabled, downside of this is the store apps don't work at all. Up side is your PC works as expected . I created a PowerShell script to download Channel 9 videos as described in my post Easily download Ch9 videos, this script worked perfectly but recently started breaking with the error
item.author: website@gordonbeeming.com (Gordon Beeming)

item.title: Download Brian Keller's VM with PowerShell
item.description: So yesterday and update for Brian Keller's VM (Visual Studio 2013 Application Lifecycle Management Virtual Machine and Hands-on-Labs / Demo Scripts) was release
item.author: website@gordonbeeming.com (Gordon Beeming)

item.title: Download #MVA Content with PowerShell
item.description: So I'm starting to go through some of the content on Microsoft Virtual Academy but I don't have time to do this when I'm by a good internet connection and at the same time don't have time when by the good internet connection to run though all the content I need to download it to watch in my spare time.
item.author: website@gordonbeeming.com (Gordon Beeming)

item.title: Easily download Ch9 videos
item.description: I watch and download a lot of videos from Channel 9 and because I'm a developer and always looking for ways to speed up anything I do I searched for a PowerShell script. I eventually found one (can't remember where) and immediately set it up to download This Week on Channel 9 and Ping Show. Over time I have added many other shows, events and series. The initial script I was found with some modifications was
item.author: website@gordonbeeming.com (Gordon Beeming)

item.title: Organize your Music Collection
item.description: I was looking for a PowerShell script that would remove all media tags (post coming) from a folder of music that I have and along the way I came across a blog post called PowerShell - Automatically organizing your mp3-collection. Although this wasn't exactly what I was looking for right now I gave it a try and then thought to share it after I made a couple of changes to make it work on my machine and categorize a bit more . You can grab the script off GitHub Gist organise-music.ps1.
item.author: website@gordonbeeming.com (Gordon Beeming)

item.title: Upgrade/Publish TFS 2013 Process Templates with PowerShell
item.description: I use to make a lot of TFS customizations and had to apply the template changes to multiple team projects which took a bit of time. Depending on the method you use it could be a quick or loooong process . When I first started doing customizations I used the TFS Power Tools to upload changes which is a lot of effort because you are uploading one work item definition at a time into one team project.
item.author: website@gordonbeeming.com (Gordon Beeming)

item.title: Configuring a Chocolatey Install
item.description: So yesterday I posted Pushing a new project to Chocolatey and I said I would create another post showing how to configure how the Chocolatey install runs and this is that post .
item.author: website@gordonbeeming.com (Gordon Beeming)

item.title: Pushing a new project to Chocolatey
item.description: Today my DotNet Pretty articles were featured on @coding4fun by Greg Duncan and one of the comments by Niner bc3tech (@bc3tech) requested that I share this solution on Chocolatey. I decided that this was a good idea and decided to share my experience .
item.author: website@gordonbeeming.com (Gordon Beeming)

item.title: Using Azure Resource Manager
item.description: In the new Azure Portal you create all your resources in Resource Groups, there is also as part of the Azure SDK's a module called AzureResourceManager by default the module loaded for the Azure SDK is AzureServiceManagement. A blurb from one of the Azure documentation page reads
item.author: website@gordonbeeming.com (Gordon Beeming)

item.title: Opening apps from the directory you in as Administrator
item.description: The other day I saw a post that Greg Duncan shared about opening CMD and PowerShell from the directory you in.

item.title: Moving Application Insights resources between subscriptions in Azure
item.description: There is documentation available for Move resources to new resource group or subscription but things are easier to do with exact sample code so here it goes . The steps below will work for moving between Resource Groups as well, you'll just skip some steps that would be obvious.
item.author: website@gordonbeeming.com (Gordon Beeming)

item.title: The Mysterious Case of the Failing Azure SQL Deployment
item.description: A perfectly stable GitHub Actions deployment to Azure SQL suddenly fails with a misleading 'Identity not found' error. Follow the debugging journey to uncover the real culprit that has nothing to do with the identity.
item.author: website@gordonbeeming.com (Gordon Beeming)
